rules.natural: If the network funds the documentary, then the project greenlights the documentary.
Whenever the team scouts the location, it follows that if the failure to greenlight the project does not lead to minimizing the impact on wildlife, then the shooting does not complete the schedule.

Under the condition that the team assesses the location, if it is not the case that not greenlighting the project implies minimizing the impact on wildlife, then the shooting does not complete the schedule.

If the crew suggests the river, then the crew recommends the location.

Under the condition that the manager coordinates the permissions, then if the assistant persuades the landowner, the landowner does not block the access.

If the team accelerates the schedule, then the production does not delay the timeline.

rules.prover9_expression: (reports(team, problem) -> (encounters(crew, obstacle) | (-(-(funds(network, documentary) | approves(producer, documentary)) -> films(location, forest)) -> -violates(permit, regulation))))
rules.natural: If the team reports the problem, then either the crew encounters the obstacle, or if the failure of having the network fund the documentary or the producer approve the documentary leads to the location filming the forest, then the permit does not violate the regulation.
If the manager resolves the issue, then the team adjusts the plan.
Provided that the crew implements the solution, then the permit does not violate the regulation.
Either the producer cuts the costs, or the production does not exceed the budget.
If the assistant finds the sponsor, then the producer seeks the sponsor.
Under the condition that the designer proposes the set, then the director considers the studio.
The designer proposes the set, or the crew advocates for the location.
Provided that the crew advocates for the location, then either the director prefers the mountain or the crew suggests the river.
If the crew obtains the permit, then the permit does not violate the regulation.

Under the condition that the impact minimizes the wildlife, then the filming does not disrupt the wildlife.
If it is not the case that the network funds the documentary or the producer approves the documentary, then the crew explores the alternative.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(verifies(researcher, data) -> (explores(crew, alternative) -> films(location, forest))) -> delays(production, timeline))
rules.natural: If it is not the case that the researcher verifying the data implies that the crew exploring the alternative leads to the location filming the forest, then the production delays the timeline.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(verifies(researcher, data) -> (explores(crew, alternative) -> films(location, forest))) -> accelerates(team, schedule))
rules.natural: Whenever the failure of the researcher verifying the data to imply that the crew exploring the alternative causes the location to film the forest occurs, then the team accelerates the schedule.
If it is not the case that the team adjusting the plan implies the crew implements the solution, then the production exceeds the budget.
Whenever the failure of the producer cutting the costs to imply the production reducing the expenses happens, then the assistant finds the sponsor.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(-(funds(network, documentary) | approves(producer, documentary)) -> films(location, forest)) -> blocks(landowner, access))
rules.natural: If it is not the case that the absence of the network funding the documentary or the producer approving the documentary implies the location films the forest, then the landowner blocks the access.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(-(funds(network, documentary) | approves(producer, documentary)) -> films(location, forest)) -> resolves(manager, issue))
rules.natural: Under the condition that not having the network fund the documentary or the producer approve the documentary does not lead to the location filming the forest, then the manager resolves the issue.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(-(funds(network, documentary) | approves(producer, documentary)) -> films(location, forest)) -> violates(permit, regulation))
rules.natural: Provided that the failure of the network not funding the documentary or the producer not approving the documentary to imply the location films the forest occurs, then the permit violates the regulation.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(-(funds(network, documentary) | approves(producer, documentary)) -> films(location, forest)) -> submits(crew, application))
rules.natural: Whenever the absence of the network funding the documentary or the producer approving the documentary does not cause the location to film the forest, then the crew submits the application.
